page.title: 08BUILDINGS - SULLINGTON
page.content: {Sullington and Chantry Lane Areas} Interesting buildings in Sullington include Sullington manor Farm, which is the only listed building. It is early eighteenth century with a central core, possible thirteenth century. Its tithe barn is one hundred and fifteen feet long, reputedly restored in 1685. Chantry Mill, now a residential unit, was formerly a working corn mill, believed to be of medievel origin. Chantry House, a late eighteenth century farmhouse with Victorian additions, takes its name from the small stone building in the grounds which was consecrated by a former owner who was led to safety over the Downs by the sound of a Church bell through the fog. Waterfall Cottage, now a very attractive house, was once a "fulling mill".
